title: Business Process Analyst
description:
At Argenta we have a passion for what we do, and we relish a challenge. This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual whose focus is continuous improvement.


So who are Argenta? Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

So who are Argenta? Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
At Argenta we have a passion for what we do, and we relish a challenge. This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual whose focus is continuous improvement.


So who are Argenta? Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
At Argenta we have a passion for what we do, and we relish a challenge. This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual whose focus is continuous improvement.


So who are Argenta? Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

So who are Argenta? Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
At Argenta we have a passion for what we do, and we relish a challenge. This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual whose focus is continuous improvement.


So who are Argenta? Founded in 2006 by a New Zealand chemist with an entrepreneurial mind, his vision was to touch lives all over the world by the creation, development and production of the best animal health technologies and products. Our vision and our people are unique and are the key to our success to date.


Argenta has continued to grow operations across multiple sites with locations in New Zealand, the United States, UK and Europe with over 700 employees globally.


The Role

As Process Improvement Analyst, you will be responsible for applying yourself and learning skills within all parts of the business. We will be asking you to be responsible for leading production process improvements and innovation.


A sample of duties you will be responsible for

  • Demonstrate steady and consistent progress in developing your knowledge of the business processes to enable you to positively contribute to operational efficiency improvement opportunities.
  • Build positive collaborative relations with internal/external stakeholders to support your development in the contribution and delivery of development projects, root cause investigations, Kaizen events, and other continuous improvement platforms
  • Be confident that you have the ability to design, plan, perform data analysis, interpret results, evaluate data, draw relevant conclusions, and write clear and informed reports to present to the business and operational teams.
  • Adhere to HSE, GMP requirements and all company procedures and policies
  • Assist with production investigations including preparing corrective and preventative action reports
  • Assist with Product and Process technical transfers from a production perspective
  • Prepare and execute process validation for equipment and processes to support Technical Services function
  • Be open to stepping out of your comfort zone and undertaking new challenges that will teach you new skills

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.


We cannot wait to hear from you!

The Candidate

To be successful in your application for the Process Improvement Analyst role you will be required to demonstrate:

  • Established process experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environment
  • Eagerness to develop and build corresponding pharmaceutical process expertise for current and novel technologies
  • Knowledge of GMP and FDA/EU manufacturing and validation regulations
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Strong communication skills in both written and verbal communication, proficient in English
  • A friendly and approachable manner, you’ll be a great team player, working and communicating effectively with colleague
  • Well-developed report writing and editing skills including the use of relevant MS Office software

You will already hold, or have an understanding of

  • Examining, developing, and implementing new strategies and procedure
  • Physical material properties, characterization and impact of material properties on manufacturing process performance.
  • The interface between equipment, processes and materials in a drug product manufacturing environment. (Non-Sterile Liquids, suspensions, gels and pastes.)
  • The utilization of data analysis, rci, tools/equipment/techniques. Using software and computer tools
  • Benefits of teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practice

Please be aware this cannot be a remote role as we want you to see first hand how we manufacture, you will need to be able to commute to our site in Dundee, Scotland.
